dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4797 IH: Enhance Access To SNAP Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

Brownley, Ms. Budzinski, Mr. Carbajal, Mr. Carson, Mr. Carter of Louisiana, Mr. Casten, Ms. Castor of Florida, Mr. Castro of Texas, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, Ms. Chu, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Whitesides, Mr. Scott of Virginia, Ms. Ansari, Mr. Amo, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Menendez, Ms. Williams of Georgia, Mr. Frost, and Ms. Barragán) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to remove certain eligibility disqualifications that restrict otherwise eligible students enrolled in institutions of higher education from participating in the supplemental nutrition assistance program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Enhance Access To SNAP Act of 2025 or the EATS Act of 2025.
The Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2011 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 3(m)(5) by adding at end the following:

subparagraph.text: Individuals who are bona fide students enrolled at least half time in any recognized school, training program, or institution of higher education.

in subsection (d)(2)(C) by striking (except that any such person enrolled in an institution of higher education shall be ineligible to participate in the supplemental nutrition assistance program unless he or she meets the requirements of subsection (e) of this section), and

section.text: This Act shall take effect on January 2, 2026.
